metadata.Title: CVE-2016-5141 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
Blink, as used in Google Chrome before 52.0.2743.116, allows remoteattackers to spoof the address bar via vectors involving a provisional URLfor an initially empty document, related to FrameLoader.cpp andScopedPageLoadDeferrer.cpp.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-5141` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 52.0.2743.116-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1250
chromium-browser-l10n - 52.0.2743.116-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1250
chromium-chromedriver - 52.0.2743.116-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1250
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 52.0.2743.116-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1250
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 52.0.2743.116-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1250
No subscription required

liboxideqt-qmlplugin - 1.17.7-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
liboxideqtcore0 - 1.17.7-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
liboxideqtquick0 - 1.17.7-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
oxideqt-codecs - 1.17.7-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
oxideqt-codecs-extra - 1.17.7-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '52.0.2743.116-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1250').
oxide-qt package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.17.7-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
